# Image Assets Guide

This folder contains all image assets used in the portfolio website.

## Required Images

### 1. profile.jpg
- **Purpose**: Main profile photo displayed on the home page
- **Recommended Size**: 200x200px (square format works best)
- **Format**: JPG or PNG
- **Tips**: Use a professional headshot with good lighting

### 2. project1.jpg
- **Purpose**: Featured image for Project 1
- **Recommended Size**: 600x400px or higher
- **Format**: JPG or PNG
- **Tips**: Use a screenshot or hero image that represents your project

### 3. project2.jpg
- **Purpose**: Featured image for Hour of Code Project
- **Recommended Size**: 600x400px or higher
- **Format**: JPG or PNG

### 4. project3.jpg
- **Purpose**: Featured image for Additional Project
- **Recommended Size**: 600x400px or higher
- **Format**: JPG or PNG

### 5. about.jpg
- **Purpose**: Image displayed on the About page
- **Recommended Size**: 500x400px or higher
- **Format**: JPG or PNG
- **Tips**: Could be a photo of you, your workspace, or something meaningful

## How to Add Images

1. Save your images in this folder with the exact filenames mentioned above
2. Ensure images are optimized for web (compressed but maintaining quality)
3. Use modern formats (JPG for photos, PNG for graphics with transparency)

## Image Optimization Tips

- Use image compression tools like TinyPNG or ImageOptim
- Keep file sizes under 500KB for best performance
- Use responsive image techniques if needed
- Ensure proper alt text is maintained in HTML

## Placeholder Images

You can use free stock photos from:
- **Unsplash** (https://unsplash.com)
- **Pexels** (https://www.pexels.com)
- **Pixabay** (https://pixabay.com)
- **Placeholder.com** (https://placeholder.com) - for temporary placeholders

## File Naming Convention

- Use lowercase with hyphens: `profile.jpg`, `my-project-1.jpg`
- Avoid spaces in filenames
- Be descriptive but concise
